newsitem.title: UK: NWE oil products mixed, naphtha falls, gas oil up.
newsitem.headline: NWE oil products mixed, naphtha falls, gas oil up.

text.p: NWE oil products were mixed on Tuesday, traders said.
Naphtha extended its recent bear trend with a combination of prompt oversupply, a weakening crack spread to crude and cheaper alternative feedstocks keeping buyers relaxed.
Gasoline prices slipped from early gains as NYMEX unleaded turned lower but prices were overall firmer on the day supported by trader hedging and refinery crude run cuts by some ARA refiners.
Gas oil gained $3-4 a tonne on the back of sharply stronger futures.
Premiums were steady to a touch easier.
High and low sulphur fuel oil were broadly stable although firmer futures were more supportive for low sulphur fuel.
